abstract: Mark V. Hurd, the chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, has been a Wall Street darling ever since he joined the giant computer maker three years ago. The company’s profits surged as Mr. Hurd deftly cut costs, increased revenue and successfully integrated several acquisitions, including the $20 billion purchase of Compaq Computer made by his predecessor.
lead_paragraph: Mark V. Hurd, the chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, has been a Wall Street darling ever since he joined the giant computer maker three years ago. The company’s profits surged as Mr. Hurd deftly cut costs, increased revenue and successfully integrated several acquisitions, including the $20 billion purchase of Compaq Computer made by his predecessor.

headline.main: With E.D.S. Deal, Wall Street Turns on H-P’s Chief
